results.title: The Journey
results.brief_description: An old man sits in a rowboat on an endless gravel ocean remembering episodes from his youth and middle age. The three vignettes presented in this film using model animation come to represent the old man’s search for spiritual meaning and purpose in his life. The tightrope becomes a metaphor for his precarious passage from boyhood to adulthood, while the door and ladder sequence comes to represent the man’s desire for meaning through material wealth. The final rowboat episode thus becomes the pinnacle of the man’s quest - a final search for fulfilment that will take him beyond life.

results.title: The Journey
results.brief_description: A quiet sensitive and beautifully photographed story of a man in middle age, who has reached a “still point” in life. Without the drive to attain the rare moments of happiness which life offers, he lapses into warm memories of a life creatively spent, inducing a sensual nostalgia which threatens to cripple him. His urban frustration takes him to an old people’s home where he gives piano lessons to the daughter of a friend. But alone, yearning for the richness and depth possible in personal relationships, his dreams become haunted by Johanna, a past love. The film can be described as a journey; not of physical life, but of the individual’s inner self moving towards a point of self-acceptance, despite life’s disappointments and increasing loss of faculties.

results.title: The Journalist
results.creator_credit: Michael Thornhill, Pom Oliver and New South Wales Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Follow the turbulent fortunes of Simon Morris, a top reporter and feature writer for a major daily newspaper. The newspaper is just a background to Simon’s lifestyle, particularly his relationship with women. Stars Jack Thompson, Elizabeth Alexander and Sam Neill.

results.title: The Jolson Story
results.creator_credit: Alfred E. Green, Sidney Skolsky and Columbia
results.brief_description: An exuberant Hollywood biography of singer, Al Jolson. The film begins with Jolson’s life as the son of a poor cantor and traces his struggle to become America’s greatest entertainer. It features a great soundtrack of Jolson’s songs including “Mammy”, “April showers” and “You made me love you”. It received an Academy Award for Musical Score and Larry Parks was awarded the Best Actor Oscar for his portrayal of Jolson.

results.title: The Jolly swagman. [Parts 1 and 2]
results.creator_credit: David Baker, Roger Mirams and Pacific Films
results.brief_description: A summer’s day in Ten Town. Young Gary (Gary Grey) is feeling dejected and neglected by his friends and decides to go for a walk. He comes across a billabong in the bush and meets a swagman (Ken Goodlet). Suddenly he is transported back in time to the 1860’s. With his record player in hand and with the help of the song Waltzing Matilda, the swagman’s life is changed.

results.title: The Jolly Jumbuck
results.brief_description: A short story involving performances by a travelling puppeteer show, The Jolly Jumbuck, which is operated by the Moonee Valley Regional Library and the Library Council of Victoria. Shows their visit to a small school in Melbourne, the Pascoe Vale South Primary School, where the puppet performance is put on for grades 5 and 6. Includes footage of the colourful puppet antics and the children’s reactions. Storytellers: Neil Bell, Oliver Roznay, Rino Tomisich. Music performed by Grades 5 and 6, Pascoe Vale South Primary School.

results.title: The Jolifou inn
results.creator_credit: Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Canada of a hundred years ago seen through the paintings of Cornelius Krieghoff, celebrated Dutch artist and adventurer. The changing seasons, the untamed beauty of the Quebec countryside and the French settlers among whom he lived were an unending source of inspiration to Krieghoff, whose work is a colourful record of French-Canadian life in the mid-19th century. Photography by Lyle Enright and Douglas Roberts. Edited by Colin Low. Music by Louis Applebaum. (Awards: Yorkton; Bilbao; Toronto; Kootenay)

results.title: The Joker to the thief
results.brief_description: A surreal hand-drawn computer animation of a thief who steals his way into a mediaeval castle. Filled with hallucenogenic imagery the thief is surrounded by magic, scenes of madness and other horrors. He attempts to flee but is followed by the joker equipped with his tricks.

results.title: The Joke = Zert [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Jaromil Jires, Milos Stejskal, Filmove Studio Barrandov and Smida-Fikar Productions
results.brief_description: Based on Milan Kundera’s novel “The Unbearable Lightness of Being”, “The Joke” is a blunt parable about the Stalinist era’s absurd insistence that every individual must, at every moment, act with the political party in mind. In the early 1950s, Louis Jahn’s studies, career and life have been disrupted beyond repair as a result of a “politically incorrect” joke he played. Fifteen years later, Louis sees a unique chance to revenge himself upon the Communist party official that bought him down. But the times have changed and life proves to be more complicated than he had expected. Jaromil Jires was one of the preeminent Czech directors of the period, and “The Joke” was one of the key works of the Czech New Wave, a highly politicised film movement that emerged in the 1960s only to be savagely repressed by the Soviet invasion of Czechoslavakia in 1968. “The Joke” was finished just before the Soviet tanks moved in to Prague and was condemned by the new government. As a result the film went largely unseen, even in its own country, for nearly two decades.

results.title: The Jointed-legged animals: arthropods
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 3. Animal life”.
This film shows the jointed-legged animals and the structural and functional characteristics of animals in the phylum arthropoda: examples from each of the five classes, and their evolutionary development. Metamorphosis and moulting processes are illustrated using photo-micrography and time-lapse photography. The economic importance to man is discussed. Suitable for upper secondary level.
